primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The empowerment of the Black church (Progressive Baptists) through their unique historical suffering to act as a redemptive force in a fractured America.

tekstueel_bewijs: Progressive Baptists, we must ask ourselves where we are going and why.
we must return to the nation bearing in Christ's name the gifts of our blackness.
We must lift the hope of life in the colony of death.
initiate the work of reconciliation which at last will make of our Baptist witness in this land one grand, united fellowship... to the healing of the nation.

zender.identificatie: The God of History / Jesus Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: I believe that God has called us out for a purpose.
We bear the crown seal of Jesus Christ. We are sent by One...
to the healing of the nation.
bear tidings of redemption to earth's darkest places.

helper.identificatie: The 'Gifts of Blackness' / The Holy Spirit (as empowerment)
tekstueel_bewijs: He gave them power and authority.
There is a power growing out of our experience of blackness in this land.
America... so unmoved, so insolent, so hard-hearted!
the ugly tools of an evil national policy.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily systemic injustice and political 'madness' rather than ontological sin or cosmic evil.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The institutional maintenance and growth of the Progressive National Baptist Convention.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Convention Leaders (Booth, Upshaw, etc.)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon oscillates between high-stakes prophetic social justice and mundane reports on committee meetings and property buying.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Black Experience → Progressive Baptists ← Systemic Racism

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has called us out for a purpose.
He gave them power and authority.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must ask ourselves where we are going.
We must return to the nation.

voorbeelden: The cry of the poor must not be stifled.
We must tell all who sent us.
I shall not dwell upon our desire to secure property.
We who minister to people must listen carefully to hear what is being said.
He gave them power and authority.
He giveth power to the faint.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily deontological (obligation-based). While it mentions 'Pouvoir' (Power), it frames this power as a resource the Subject must now use to fulfill the 'Devoir' (Must).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'shame' of division (~S1) and national 'madness' (S2) toward a redemptive 'apartness' that leads back to reconciliation (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'empowerment' of the Black church to save the nation from its own judgment.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Judgment is presented as a historical inevitability for a nation that ignores the poor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses Christological language at the end, the primary engine is anthropocentric: the church is the Subject who must act to save the nation. God is the Sender and the Enabler (Helper), but the 'Performance' belongs to the Progressive Baptists.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We must... we must... we must...
He gave them power... [so that they can act].

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: We are sent by a God who came where we are in Jesus of Nazareth in order that we might get where he is.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Martin Luther King Jr. and Robert Kennedy are used as the primary moral and spiritual standards for the Subject to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on God as the one who raised up King and who alone sustains the movement, rather than the movement 'longing' for King's return.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Increases sense of responsibility and communal pride, but risks exhaustion under the weight of 'must'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: The church becomes the co-redeemer of the nation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon struggles to integrate the 'Fundamental Program' (God's salvation in Christ) with the 'Secondary Program' (Institutional Baptist business).
spanning_punten: The transition from the 'anguished cry of the disinherited' to 'our Christian Education Congress goes forward under the leadership of Dr. William Upshaw'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: We must return to the nation bearing in Christ's name the gifts of our blackness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of 'Power' to the human Subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Social and national sin (Vietnam, poverty) is treated with extreme gravity.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon positions the Progressive Baptists as the Subject of a national rescue mission, with God as the source of power (Helper) and mandate (Sender).

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The 'We' (Progressive Baptists) are doing all the heavy lifting in the active verbs.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the national healing.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must initiate the work of reconciliation,' use 'God is initiating reconciliation through our brokenness.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Hero' who must save America.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' of God's power first.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'Wait upon the Lord' aspect of Isaiah 40 more than the 'Mounting up'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on the 'credentials of identification' in Christ as the source of ability, not just a label for the mission.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The social opponent is already very intense.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon excels at naming social sin.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The business of the convention (Program 2) is given equal narrative weight to the mission of God (Program 1).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Subordinate institutional reports to the theological narrative of empowerment.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful prophetic address that successfully identifies the 'Power of Blackness' as a theological category, but occasionally slips into institutional moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would praise the 'I Have a Dream' echoes; Greimas reveals that these echoes reinforce a human-centered Subject-Object axis.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the context of Luke 9; Greimas looks at how 'Power' functions as a modal competence for the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that despite the 'Jesus' language at the end, the 'engine' of the sermon is the Baptist Convention's agency.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Social Gospel' actantial structure where the Church takes the place of the Spirit as the primary actor in history.
